page.title: 01Worstead and Sloley
page.content: The villages of Worstead and Sloley lie in middle of a fertile farming aea (arable and dairy) with populations of 600 and 200 respectively. Worstead, the ancient home of weavers and worstd cloth 8with 17 century wevers cottage still visible) is at present better known for the annual 3 day festival raising money for its historic 14th century church of St Marys and other village amenities including new village hall opened by Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother in August 1985. Sloley parish church, St Bartholomews is even older dated from 13c. Worstead still has a railway station on Norwich Cromer line whose future despite many branch line closures in Norfolk seem reasonably secure at present. The largest employer of labour in re is Ross Foots Ltd a canning and food processing
